history.content:
There were a couple students this summer who were looking into 47F, and they ended up having to file a petition with L&S to try and make that count for the CS minor.  Your best first step would probably be to contact Antoine Davis (antoined at cs dot berkeley dot edu) to ask about filing that petition.

(As a note, I know at least one of the two students had their petition denied, so it's not a guaranteed thing.  But there was some chatter amongst the professors about changing the minor requirements to allow 55 in the place of 70, so things may have improved since then.)

I'm a math/stat major looking into the CS minor, and I've already taken MATH55, CS170, STAT134, etc. Does anyone have any experience with EECS47F or know if it can be waived? It seems a little backwards to take this class now as a senior, but I'm only 2 classes away from the minor so I thought I might as well complete it.
history.subject: EECS 47F
